from .views import chatbot_response, home_view

    # For GET requests to the root URL
    path('', home_view),
    # Handling form submits by POST for the /response API endpoint
    path('response/', chatbot_response,name="chatbot_response"),
]

10.code:
from django.db import models

class User(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=255)
    email = models.EmailField(unique=True)

class FoodItem(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(max_length=255)
    calories = models.IntegerField()

class UserFoodLog(models.Model):
    user = models.ForeignKey(User, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
    food_item = models.ForeignKey(FoodItem, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
    consumption_date = models.DateField()
    quantity = models.IntegerField()

from django.shortcuts import render
from .models import User, FoodItem, UserFoodLog
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def index(request):
    users = User.objects.all()
    return render(request, 'index.html', {'users': users})

def log_food(request): # GET user id and food item details
    if request.method == 'GET':
        user_id = request.GET['user_id']
        food_item_name = request.GET['food_item_name']
        food_item_calories = FoodItem.objects.get(name=food_item_name).calories
        UserFoodLog(user=request.user, food_item=FoodItem.objects.get(name=food_item_name), consumption_date=datetime.date.today(), quantity=1).save()
    return render(request, 'log_food.html')

def analysis(request): # GET user's log and display chart
    user_id = request.GET['user_id']
    user_log = UserFoodLog.objects.filter(user=User.objects.get(id=user_id))
    food_names = [log.food_item.name for log in user_log]
    calories_consumed = [log.quantity * FoodItem.objects.get(name=log.food_item.name).calories for log in user_log]
    plt.bar(food_names, calories_consumed)
    return HttpResponse(fig)
